page.title: 13On Saturdays (1) by Alan
page.content: On Saturdays I get up at half-past eight. I go to the bathroom, get washed and go downstairs. Whilst my mum gets breakfast I read the newspaper and "Shoot", which is a magazine about football. I always have a big breakfast of mushrooms, tinned tomatoes, egg and bread because I play football in the afternoon. I go out to play football on the park and then come in for a sandwich. Then I go to play with my team. If we are going to play away we meet in Main Street, but if we are at home we meet at the Highfield ground. I take the kits because my mam washes them. They are white shirts with blue shorts and socks. You have to be under twelve years to be in the League and I am the youngest. I am a striker.
